intro: Asperula laevis, commonly known as the smooth asperula, is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to parts of Europe, North Africa, and western Asia. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in woodland areas and along stream banks, preferring moist, well-drained soils. Asperula laevis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in partial shade.
